reasoning: Rare genetic imprinting disorder with incidence of approximately 1 in 15,000-25,000 live births (0.06-0.09 per 100k). Estimated ~6,400 cases annually based on global birth rates. Moderate confidence: well-defined genetic entity with established diagnostic criteria, data from genetic registries and birth defect surveillance, but limited epidemiological studies.
source: Genetic registries and birth defect surveillance databases; genetic testing enables consistent diagnosis
